author: sussman
msg: Begin work on issue #730:  restartable checkouts.
Part 1: expand the reporter interface, so a 'low confidence' client
can say it has a specific revision of a directory with zero entries.
[ It turns out that it's not good to overload the directory revnum;
there are scenarios where we need to know *both* that a) the entries
file is incomplete, and b) what revnum the directory was trying to
be.  Therefore, a new entries file will always have a valid revnum
attached to THIS_DIR, and some other entry-flag indicating that the
directory is incomplete.  And this changeset is about marshalling
that future flag over the network. ]
argument, and possibly call remove_directory_children() after doing
take new 'start_empty' argument, pass into the libsvn_repos funcs of
new 'start_empty' argument.  if present, marshall as start-empty xml
attribute always set to 'true'.  otherwise don't send attribute at all.
'start-empty' xml attribute if present, pass into
'start_empty' arguments, unconditionally marshall as boolean over
* svnserve/serve.c (set_path, link_path): parse new boolean argument
out of the tuple, pass into svn_repos funcs.
* libsn_client/diff.c (do_merge, do_diff): update callers; pass FALSE
update callers; pass FALSE for now.  In the future, this crawler
will learn to make use of the flag when it sees incomplete entries
